intro: Echidnopsis sharpei, commonly known as the Cape flower, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, which is commonly referred to as the "ice plant" family. The plant is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves and vibrant, star-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of yellow and orange. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, making it well adapted to drought conditions. Echidnopsis sharpei is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking appearance and low maintenance requirements.
